commit_message:
Fix incorrect lcmocc_id specified in "get_lcmocc"

This patch fixes incorrect lcmocc_id is specified in
"get_lcmocc" function if the lcmocc_id does not exist
in VnfLcmOpOccV2.

Closes-Bug: #2007819
Change-Id: Ic64f1916fd90888bee8bc504eb3c493f1f2d6341
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tacker refs/changes/29/874529/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: lcmocc_id = 'f5aa2eb2-6805-439d-b93d-bb0db8d96e3b' ex = self.assertRaises( lcmocc_utils.get_lcmocc, context, lcmocc_id) expected_detail = f'VnfLcmOpOcc {lcmocc_id} not found.' self.assertEqual(expected_detail, ex.detail)

commit_message:
Follow up: Hitachi: Change option name `hitachi_pool` to `hitachi_pools`

This patch changes option name ``hitachi_pool`` to ``hitachi_pools`` and
to set ``hitachi_pool`` as deprecated name, along review comment[*1]
On the related patch[*2], we've supported MULTIPLE pools,
but option name is still ``hitachi_pool``.
	
[1] review comment: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/846977/2/cinder/volume/drivers/hitachi/hbsd_common.py#52
[2] Related-Id: I49ac061011293900b04a7a5b90ff5b840521993d

Change-Id: Ib18cd1ed2c2dcc0b664dc4373a0546205386ed79

subject: Fix validator for tagless deliverables
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-02-27 16:17:17.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_releases/tests/test_validate.py', 'openstack_releases/cmds/validate.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/releases/commit/32c9bc69eba61ecbfaee257fb4fd55421d3ce8bf', 'message': "Fix validator for tagless deliverables

With the new release identification / naming schema [1] (like:
2023.1 Antelope) new stable branch naming was introduced (like:
stable/2023.1). This was not accepted in the validator command.
Previously the validator was fixed for 'std' and 'std-with-versions'
branching typed deliverables, but missed the 'tagless' deliverables
case. This patch fixes this by accepting the new branch naming style,
stable/<release-id>, for tagless deliverables, too.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/release-naming.html

Change-Id: I6ba51454213e095e6b76e0813dab3ce44b1457ba
"}]
commit_message:
Fix validator for tagless deliverables

With the new release identification / naming schema [1] (like:
2023.1 Antelope) new stable branch naming was introduced (like:
stable/2023.1). This was not accepted in the validator command.
Previously the validator was fixed for 'std' and 'std-with-versions'
branching typed deliverables, but missed the 'tagless' deliverables
case. This patch fixes this by accepting the new branch naming style,
stable/<release-id>, for tagless deliverables, too.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/release-naming.html

Change-Id: I6ba51454213e095e6b76e0813dab3ce44b1457ba

commit_message:
Release freezer-web-ui RC1 for Antelope

This proposed a RC1 release for freezer-web-ui to get any merged changes
out prior to the RC1 deadline for Antelope going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by early Friday, March 03.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 13.0.0..33db4d1

Signed-off-by: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ib44f9d22e3a6c4491abd4d5008fe64088afca16e

commit_message:
Rectify service_name in ceph monitor's hieradata

"ceph-mon.yaml" should populate collectd hieradata for "ceph_mon"
instead of "ceph_osd".

Add example mons and osds daemons for collectd to monitor in
CI environment files.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/873774
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/873775

This change is wallaby-backport-potential.

Resolves: rhbz#2116340
Change-Id: I5d6626774de7aeac9bbc5d70d856eeaba987714b
(cherry picked from commit a7d94bb9712d2bbb24970277de59abe9b8e239c6)

commit_message:
Remove TripleO job

... because it has been non-voting and has never attracted actual
attention. Also the job is not used in core Neutron and there is no
quite clear reason to run this job only for this plugin.

Change-Id: Ic89541dbcb1ac671dee8f1862db55ee123017d1c

commit_message:
Follow up: Hitachi: Change option name `hitachi_pool` to `hitachi_pools`
	
	This patch changes option name ``hitachi_pool`` to ``hitachi_pools`` and
	to set ``hitachi_pool`` as deprecated name, along review comment[*1]
	On the related patch[*2], we've supported MULTIPLE pools,
	but option name is still ``hitachi_pool``.
	
	[1] review comment: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/846977/2/cinder/volume/drivers/hitachi/hbsd_common.py#52
[2] Related-Id: I49ac061011293900b04a7a5b90ff5b840521993d

Change-Id: Ia6c83094a056b82311acf3e744aeaafbfc92e9b3

subject: neutron-taas-tcpdump: A small utility to exec tcpdump using taas
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-05 17:27:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tap-as-a-service/commit/2ea6c2e3170c873c8dc38eb0110b51ecf888d541', 'message': 'neutron-taas-tcpdump: A small utility to exec tcpdump using taas

For example, the following dumps the traffic on the port specified
by the uuid:

    % cat taas-tcpdump.ini
    [DEFAULT]
    interface_driver = midonet
    ovs_use_veth = False
    debug = False
    verbose = True
    % neutron-taas-tcpdump --config-file taas-tcpdump.ini --port <uuid>

Depends-On: I9fa21bb273ef8a5c6fabece0a29673839cf8e945

commit_message:
neutron-taas-tcpdump: A small utility to exec tcpdump using taas

For example, the following dumps the traffic on the port specified
by the uuid:

    % cat taas-tcpdump.ini
    [DEFAULT]
    interface_driver = midonet
    ovs_use_veth = False
    debug = False
    verbose = True
    % neutron-taas-tcpdump --config-file taas-tcpdump.ini --port <uuid>

Change-Id: Iad4daaceff9dfe5005b054e12cdd1490f66d2ca2

commit_message:
delete mirror traffic vlan tag

http://www.openvswitch.org/support/dist-docs/ovs-vswitchd.conf.db.5.txt
The VLAN configuration in this column affects Open vSwitch only when it
is doing ''normal switching.'' It does not affect flows set  up  by
an OpenFlow controller, outside of the OpenFlow ''normal action.''

so output action does not strip vlan header, this vlan is local to br-int，
tap service vm receives mirrored packet with this vlan, useless.

Closes-Bug: #1870083
Change-Id: I7340e0101feb497441445b6e1b6edc41f81f17fc

commit_message:
Support for ovs-dpdk

1. While creating br-tap bridge, pass an additional argument, i.e.
   datapath_type. This parameter is read from openvswitch.ini
   conf file.

2. Add tunneling flows for taas only when tunneling is enabled.

Change-Id: I1520efc10852a5f91403d5637a14cb81a6f5a42c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tap-as-a-service refs/changes/94/674694/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.datapath_type = cfg.CONF.OVS.datapath_type self.tap_br = OVSBridge_tap_extension('br-tap', datapath_type=self.datapath_type, self.root_helper)

commit_message:
Force generation of Karaf logs to avoid POST_FAILUREs

Whenever the Karaf log is not generated, the CI job fails with a
POST_FAILURE error because the log is missing upon collection. This
usually happens when devstack fails to start.

This patch generates an empty file before Karaf is run. This way if
there is a failure and the log is not generated the job wouldn't fail.

Change-Id: Ibb84940a380c6b5c8ea9bc01c4c39bcd5b48db19
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl refs/changes/36/548036/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Replace deprecated regex escape

In Python 3.5 the escape character '\S' was deprecated [1] (among
others). In Python 3.6 this became an error.

This patch replaces the deprecated regex with the recommended
alternative [2].

[1]: https://bugs.python.org/issue30187
[2]: https://docs.python.org/3/library/re.html#regular-expression-syntax

Change-Id: If6c09bd36057453b5b9bd13485324353669771d0

commit_message:
Websocket conn should not give up on 404

There is really no good reason to give up
on retrying since the system will not work
without the websocket. Specifically, 404
errors causing the thread to exit was
observed to cause problems in netvirt's
cluster CSIT.

In general, there are other issues with the
ws registration code that should be fixed.
However, it makes sense to wait a little while
and see how the new pre-registration functionality
plays out.

Change-Id: I26527c237d8abfd6dfcf9e9630d44b65cc46d6da
Signed-off-by: Josh <jhershbe@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl refs/changes/32/617132/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LOG.warning("websocket connection failed, " "create-data-change-event-subscription " "returned %i", e.response.status_code, exc_info=True) return None LOG.warning("websocket connection failed, " "stream subscription " "returned %i", e.response.status_code, exc_info=True) return None
deleted_lines: # restconf returns 400 on operation when path is not available if e.response.status_code == codes.bad_request: LOG.debug("response code bad_request (400)" "check path for websocket connection") raise ValueError(_("bad_request (http400),check path.")) else: LOG.warning("websocket connection failed", exc_info=True) return None # restconf returns 404 on operation when there is no entry if e.response.status_code == codes.not_found: LOG.debug("response code not_found (404)" "unable to websocket connection url") raise ValueError(_("bad_request (http400),check path")) else: LOG.warning("websocket connection failed") return None

commit_message:
Initial commit of the SBI revision system

This patch implements the basic API for the SBI revision system, as
defined by the neutron spec [1].

[1]:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/sbi-database-consistency

Change-Id: I58cc11d8451fe586bad5c83274144f83ee420e6a
Implements: blueprint sbi-database-consistency

subject: Re-enable support for multiple router-associations to a single bgpvpn for opendaylight
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-31 08:38:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl/commit/daa446082e882c336b1e989d774042facbf4a682', 'message': 'Re-enable support for multiple router-associations to a single bgpvpn for opendaylight

At present, ODL driver code does not allow bgpvpn to be associated with
multiple routers. This fix removes that check and allows multiple
router associations for a bgpvpn.

This fix is required for supporting dual stack vms as detailed in ODL spec:
https://git.opendaylight.org/gerrit/#/c/54089/

Change-Id: Ide3c8b406c9916f717d1bd635c944f45f27f0ff1
Signed-off-by: Yenuganti Vasudha <yenuganti.vasudha@ericsson.com>

'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2018-11-14 09:10:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl/commit/a625755a81d2ddefa653de55834e6653f47e1b8a', 'message': 'Re-enable support for multiple router-associations to a single bgpvpn for opendaylight

At present, ODL driver code does not allow bgpvpn to be associated with
multiple routers. This fix removes that check and allows multiple
router associations for a bgpvpn.

This fix is required for supporting dual stack vms as detailed in ODL spec:

commit_message:
Re-enable support for multiple router-associations to a single bgpvpn for opendaylight

At present, ODL driver code does not allow bgpvpn to be associated with
multiple routers. This fix removes that check and allows multiple
router associations for a bgpvpn.

If ODL supports this feature, ODL will provide bgpvpn_multiple_routers feature attribute in the feature list during features negotiation.

This fix is required for supporting dual stack vms as detailed in ODL spec:
https://git.opendaylight.org/gerrit/#/c/54089/

Change-Id: Ide3c8b406c9916f717d1bd635c944f45f27f0ff1
Signed-off-by: Yenuganti Vasudha <yenuganti.vasudha@ericsson.com>
Signed-off-by: Deepthi V V <deepthi.v.v@ericsson.com>

commit_message:
Reduce the clutter in the REST client

The current REST client has two methods that are used to make a REST
request, sendjson() and request(). The problem with this is that it
creates some confusion as to which method to use.

This patch simplifies the API by consolidating the functionality of both
under a new method send_request().

Change-Id: Iaff4e7d04c3ea42f38a5280b07f7b34022432e89

commit_message:
Move get_resource() from the client to the journal

This is a function that relates to the journal and not to the client.

This patch moves it to the journal.

Change-Id: Id873fe651a434bb3928932ee9d56187df57735b7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl refs/changes/51/593551/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from networking_odl.journal import journal return journal.get_resource( self.client, resource_type, resource[resource_type]['id'])

commit_message:
The v2 driver interface from networking-odl for managing a neutron bgpvpn
should match the signature imposed by the driver-api of networking-bgpvpn.

However, we noticed that the signature of update_bgpvpn_precommit method
was incorrect compared to the networking-bgpvpn driver_api.py.

https://github.com/openstack/networking-bgpvpn/blob/master/networking_bgpvpn/
neutron/services/service_drivers/driver_api.py#L265

This review fixes the signature in our ODL v2 driver for bgpvpn to enable
the update_bgpvpn functionality to work.

Change-Id: I0d0c5c60e05b21a0c0878b1693355703036141d3
Signed-off-by: Yenuganti Vasudha <yenuganti.vasudha@ericsson.com>
Closes-Bug:#1720057
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl refs/changes/61/634861/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _add_rd(self, bgpvpn, rd): bgpvpn['route_distinguishers'].append(rd) return bgpvpn def _delete_rd(self, bgpvpn, rd): bgpvpn['route_distinguishers'].remove(rd) return bgpvpn def _get_fake_updated_bgpvpn(self): bgpvpn = self._get_fake_bgpvpn(); new_bgpvpn = self._add_rd(bgpvpn, '100:2') fake_updated_bgpvpn = self._delete_rd(new_bgpvpn, '100:1') return fake_updated_bgpvpn fake_updated_data = self._get_fake_updated_bgpvpn() self.driver.update_bgpvpn_precommit(self.db_context, fake_data, fake_updated_data)

subject: Use Neon for grenade job
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-02-25 14:50:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl/commit/ae3b48c08931ca36cac806a0b7865a8391a3049b', 'message': "Use Oxygen for grenade job

Grenade jobs are failing [1] since there is no snapshot release from ODL
version Nitrogen (0.7) any more as it is in End Of Life state.

There is two option to fix this error:
1. use ODL version Oxygen (0.8) as the old ODL version for upgrade test
2. download Nitrogen from opendaylight's releases page and not from the
   snapshot page.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/90/633190/21/check/networking-odl-grenade/4de6297/logs/grenade.sh.txt.gz#_2019-02-25_06_46_42_460

Change-Id: Ifa36ab297540da21a2a997c90e82273292c918b0
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2019-07-02 13:42:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl/commit/6f95e651c25bba523fe2f8d4c4dd1fb5c70d1bbb', 'message': "Use Oxygen for grenade job

Grenade jobs are failing [1] since there is no snapshot release from ODL
version Nitrogen (0.7) any more as it is in End Of Life state.

There is two option to fix this error:
1. use ODL version Oxygen (0.8) as the old ODL version for upgrade test
2. download Nitrogen from opendaylight's releases page and not from the
   snapshot page.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/90/633190/21/check/networking-odl-grenade/4de6297/logs/grenade.sh.txt.gz#_2019-02-25_06_46_42_460

Change-Id: Ifa36ab297540da21a2a997c90e82273292c918b0

commit_message:
Use Neon for grenade job

Grenade jobs are failing [1] since there is no snapshot release from ODL
version Nitrogen (0.7) any more as it is in End Of Life state.

To solve this use ODL version Neon (0.10) as the old ODL version for
upgrade test.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/90/633190/21/check/networking-odl-grenade/4de6297/logs/grenade.sh.txt.gz#_2019-02-25_06_46_42_460

Change-Id: Ifa36ab297540da21a2a997c90e82273292c918b0

commit_message:
[train][goal] Define new ipv6-only job for gate

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
Tempest has defined the base job 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' (adding
in Depends-On patch) which will deploy services on IPv6.

This commit adds the new job 'networking-odl-tempest-oxygen-ipv6-only'
run on gate which is derived from 'devstack-tempest-ipv6'.

Verification structure will be:
- 'devstack-IPv6' deploy the service on IPv6
- 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' run will verify the IPv6-only setting and listen address
- 'networking-odl-tempest-oxygen-ipv6-only' will run the tests.

Story: #2005477
Task: #35906

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

Change-Id: I089ba1dccb35d53d1568d86841c5de1fe7f9d0e1

commit_message:
Add support for IPv6 lb management network

Downstream Wallaby backport candidate.

This will use the existing lb_mgmt_subnet_cidr setting
to decide whether IPv6 is used and configure the deployment accordingly.

 Conflicts:
	tripleo_ansible/roles/octavia_controller_config/tasks/netport.yml

Change-Id: I735a905fa42a354cb2547e4fc96c396af914a529

commit_message:
Rectify service_name in ceph monitor's hieradata

"ceph-mon.yaml" should populate collectd hieradata for "ceph_mon"
instead of "ceph_osd".

Add example mons and osds daemons for collectd to monitor in
CI environment files.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/873910
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/873789

This change is wallaby-backport-potential.

Resolves: rhbz#2116340
Change-Id: I5d6626774de7aeac9bbc5d70d856eeaba987714b
(cherry picked from commit a7d94bb9712d2bbb24970277de59abe9b8e239c6)

commit_message:
[sqlalchemy-20] Use Connection.execute() instead of Engine.execute()

According to the SLQAlchemy documentation, "the Engine.execute() method
is considered legacy as of the 1.x series of SQLAlchemy and will be
removed in 2.0. All statement execution in SQLAlchemy 2.0 is performed
by the Connection.execute() method of Connection, or in the ORM by the
Session.execute() method of Session."

Change-Id: Ic4d7a0740f7136cac2055e57e57f66e76cb150f3
Closes-Bug: #2008223

deleted_lines: self.engine.execute("PRAGMA foreign_keys=ON") def disable_fks(): with self.engine.connect() as conn: conn.connection.rollback() conn.execute("PRAGMA foreign_keys=OFF") self.addCleanup(disable_fks)

added_lines: class DeleteRouterAssociation(tables.DeleteAction): url = 'horizon:project:router:detail' @staticmethod def action_present(count): return ungettext_lazy(u"Delete Router Association", u"Delete Router Associations", count) @staticmethod def action_past(count): return ungettext_lazy(u"Deleted Router Association", u"Deleted Router Associations", count) def delete(self, request, bgpvpn_id): router_id = self.table.kwargs['router_id'] try: assos_list = bgpvpn_api.router_association_list( request, bgpvpn_id, router_id=router_id) router_asso = assos_list[0] bgpvpn_api.router_association_delete( request, router_asso.id, bgpvpn_id) except Exception: msg = _('Failed to delete Router Association associated with' ' %s') % bgpvpn_id LOG.info(msg) redirect = reverse(self.url) exceptions.handle(request, msg, redirect=redirect) class BgpvpnTableInRouterPanel(BgpvpnTable): class Meta(object): name = "bgpvpns" verbose_name = _("BGPVPN") table_actions = (DeleteRouterAssociation,) row_actions = (EditInfoBgpVpn, DeleteRouterAssociation,)

fix release notes appearing on wrong branch

Tell reno to explicitly ignore, for master branch,
notes that belonged to stable/queens but where first
committed on master after stable/queens forked.

Story: 2001874
Change-Id: I3cf07d905a4ec725ac8d854e9e6654a5cc819cea

commit_message:
Add py36 testenv

Python 3.6 is installed by default in Ubuntu 18.04 LTS.
Therefore, according to Transition Plan [1],
it'll be handy to have py36 testenv.

For more details, please check Python2 Deprecation Timeline [2]
and Python3-first Goal - Completion Criteria [3].

[1] https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Python/Python36Transition
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20180529-python2-deprecation-timeline.html
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/575933/8/goals/stein/python3-first.rst@42

Change-Id: Id5eb24b0df624ac1461a327ae11d818f80c2bbc4

commit_message:
[train][goal] Define new networking-bgpvpn-functional-ipv6-only job

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
we need to define the integration job which deploy services
on IPv6 and perform testing to make sure service listen and communicate
over IPv6 properly.

networking-bgpvpn has legacy zuul jobs only so base zuulv3 IPv6 job 'devstack-ipv6' and
'devstack-tempest-ipv6' cannot be used and we have to copy the whole
run.yaml to set the IPv6 setting and run the IPv6 verification
script via post_test_hook.

This commit adds the new job 'networking-bgpvpn-functional-ipv6-only'
run on gate and set the required IPv6 setting'.

Story: #2005477
Task: #35908

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

Change-Id: I99e3314c6ba73994863b27525c83b438d91192a2

commit_message:
Handle network/router delete

On deletion of Network and Router neutron resource, which could be in
valid associations with existing BGPVPNs, we need to explicitly trigger
disassociation of themselves from all such BGPVPNs.

Change-Id: I988c22a2b99b490facfd9de12ac963c625e5a308
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-bgpvpn refs/changes/60/555260/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: registry.subscribe(self._notify_delete_router_precommit, resources.ROUTER, events.PRECOMMIT_DELETE) registry.subscribe(self._notify_delete_net_precommit, resources.NETWORK, events.PRECOMMIT_DELETE) def _notify_delete_net_precommit(self, resource, event, trigger, **kwargs): context = kwargs.get('context') net_id = kwargs.get('network_id') plugin = directory.get_plugin() network = plugin.get_network(context, net_id) nets_bgpvpns = self.driver.get_bgpvpns( context, filters={ 'networks': [net_id], 'tenant_id': [network['tenant_id']] }, ) if nets_bgpvpns: for net_bgpvpn in nets_bgpvpns: assoc = self.get_bgpvpn_network_associations( context, net_bgpvpn['id'], filters={ 'network_id': [net_id], 'tenant_id': [network['tenant_id']] } ) self.delete_bgpvpn_network_association( context, assoc[0]['id'], net_bgpvpn['id']) def _notify_delete_router_precommit(self, resource, event, trigger, **kwargs): context = kwargs.get('context') router_id = kwargs.get('router_id') router = kwargs.get('router_db') routers_bgpvpns = self.driver.get_bgpvpns( context, filters={ 'routers': [router_id], 'tenant_id': [router['tenant_id']] }, ) if routers_bgpvpns: for router_bgpvpn in routers_bgpvpns: assoc = self.get_bgpvpn_router_associations( context, router_bgpvpn['id'], filters={ 'router_id': [router_id], 'tenant_id': [router['tenant_id']] } ) self.delete_bgpvpn_router_association( context, assoc[0]['id'], router_bgpvpn['id'])

commit_message:
Disable BGPVPN panels when extension is missing

Auto-disable the project and admin BGP VPN Interconnection pannels
when the 'bgpvpn' Neutron API extension is not available as per
actual extension list api.

Change-Id: I5ac4af019ffed9ebca53dfc05076142816118d25

This is likely " "due to a problem communicating with the Neutron " "endpoint. BGP VPN Interconnections Admin panel " "will not be displayed.") return False return super(BGPVPNInterconnections, self).allowed(context)

commit_message:
Allow sharing BGPVPNs via RBAC machanism.

After this change the end-user will be able to control
router and network associations for shared BGPVPNs.

Partial-Bug: #1931100
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-lib/+/795423

Change-Id: I7304dcc908a3e782bed07b1bd21c974cdf32aed7

added_lines: from oslo_utils import uuidutils from neutron.db import rbac_db_modelsfrom neutron_lib.db import api as db_apifrom networking_bgpvpn.neutron.db.bgpvpn_db import BGPVPNRBAC self.ctx.tenant_id = self._tenant_id {"tenant_id": self.ctx.tenant_id, 'tenant_id': self.ctx.tenant_id} self.assertEqual(False, bgpvpn['shared']) self.assertEqual(False, bgpvpn['shared']) def test_bgpvpn_shared(self): # create bgpvpn = self.plugin_db.create_bgpvpn( self.ctx, { "tenant_id": self.ctx.tenant_id, "type": "l3", "name": "", "route_targets": ["64512:1"], "import_targets": ["64512:11", "64512:12"], "export_targets": ["64512:13", "64512:14"], "route_distinguishers": ["64512:15", "64512:16"], "vni": "1000", "local_pref": "777" } ) target_tenant = uuidutils.generate_uuid() with db_api.CONTEXT_WRITER.using(self.ctx): self.ctx.session.add(BGPVPNRBAC( object_id=bgpvpn['id'], target_tenant=target_tenant, action=rbac_db_models.ACCESS_SHARED, object_type=BGPVPNRBAC.object_type, project_id=self._tenant_id, )) # check ctx = context.Context(tenant_id=target_tenant, overwrite=False) bgpvpn = self.plugin_db.get_bgpvpn(ctx, bgpvpn['id']) self.assertEqual(True, bgpvpn['shared'])

commit_message:
Keystone: Allow configurable OIDC outgoing proxy URL

Allow the user to specify an outgoing proxy URL for OIDC
(OIDCOutgoingProxy for mod_auth_openidc)

Change-Id: I0c09ce8b8c4fbe50a1c11de60bd40eb1f46fe644
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/23/875623/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: If you need to use a proxy to reach the JWKS URL (for example, because your OpenStack environment is behind a corporate firewall requiring the use of a proxy for public internet access), you can specify this using the `keystone_federation_oidc_outgoing_proxy` variable: .. code-block:: yaml keystone_federation_oidc_outgoing_proxy: "https://<PROXY FQDN>:<PROXY PORT>/"

commit_message:
Switch to 2023.1 Python3 unit tests and generic template name

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for antelope. Also,
updating the template name to generic one.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

Change-Id: I3d64a55d7d1306520d8a6c168a245c71aecad67d

commit_message:
Update master for stable/zed

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/zed.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/zed.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: I5e3106ac97b02bf90d0428b1047a611926ceed19

commit_message:
add a fullstack test for BGPVPN router fallback

Add a test checking that routing traffic via
a Neutron router coexists with having the network
or the router associated to a BGPVPN.

Change-Id: I91d164359b47c168addaa8da1c75efa31430d158

added_lines: def test_router_fallback(self): tenant_uuid = uuidutils.generate_uuid() bgpvpn = self.safe_client.create_bgpvpn(tenant_uuid, route_targets=['64512:1']) networkA1 = self.safe_client.create_network(tenant_uuid) subnetA1 = self.safe_client.create_subnet( tenant_uuid, networkA1['id'], '41.0.0.0/24') networkA2 = self.safe_client.create_network(tenant_uuid) subnetA2 = self.safe_client.create_subnet( tenant_uuid, networkA2['id'], '42.0.0.0/24') networkB = self.safe_client.create_network(tenant_uuid) subnet2 = self.safe_client.create_subnet( tenant_uuid, networkB['id'], '20.0.0.0/24') router = self.safe_client.create_router(tenant_uuid) self.safe_client.add_router_interface(router['id'], subnetA1['id']) self.safe_client.add_router_interface(router['id'], subnetA2['id']) self.safe_client.create_network_association(tenant_uuid, bgpvpn['id'], networkA1['id']) self.safe_client.create_network_association(tenant_uuid, bgpvpn['id'], networkB['id']) fake_machines = list() for network in (networkA1, networkA2, networkB): fake_machines.append([ self.useFixture( machine.FakeFullstackMachine( self.environment.hosts[i], network['id'], tenant_uuid, self.safe_client)) for i in range(self.compute_node_count)*self.port_per_compute_per_net]) # all VMs: vms = machine.FakeFullstackMachinesList(fake_machines[0] + fake_machines[1] + fake_machines[2]) # machines in subnet A1 and A2, connected via the router vms_connected_via_router = machine.FakeFullstackMachinesList( fake_machines[0] + fake_machines[1]) # machines in subnet A1 and B, connected via the BGP VPN vms_connected_via_bgpvpn = machine.FakeFullstackMachinesList( fake_machines[0] + fake_machines[2]) vms.block_until_all_boot() vms_connected_via_router.ping_all() vms_connected_via_bgpvpn.ping_all()

commit_message:
Bump the openstackdocstheme extension to 1.20

Some options are now automatically configured by the version 1.20:
- project
- html_last_updated_fmt
- latex_engine
- latex_elements
- version
- release.

Change-Id: I487fc4910f880aec10ff50f06fe77787dd08e921

commit_message:
Flood broadcast to dhcp tunnels

The patch makes sure broadcast traffic is sent not only to EVPN
tunnels, but for original neutron tunnels with DHCP. Mirror
rule for ARP responder with higher priority than flooding.

Closes-Bug: #1915522
Change-Id: Ia5f4d33421f12ffacf88764da8a1bc4659c4a398

commit_message:
Handle network update notifications

Handle network update notifications to make sure
we adjust rules for network that was plugged to router
after it is associated with bgpvpn.

Closes-Bug: #1897408

Change-Id: I7369849754778c61fcf207f1823233e232d09e97

added_lines: from networking_bagpipe.agent import agent_base_infofrom neutron.api.rpc.callbacks import resources as resources_apifrom neutron.objects import network as network_object def _network_update_notif(self, network, event_type): self.agent_ext.handle_network_event( None, resources_api.NETWORK, [network], event_type) def _make_network(self): segment = network_object.NetworkSegment( physical_network='fake physnet') network = network_object.Network(self.context, segments=[segment]) return network def test_network_event_no_association(self): network = network_object.Network(self.context, **base.NETWORK1) net_info = agent_base_info.NetworkInfo(base.NETWORK1['id']) self.agent_ext.networks_info = {base.NETWORK1['id']: net_info} self.agent_ext._add_association_for_net = mock.Mock() self.agent_ext._remove_association_for_net = mock.Mock() self.agent_ext.handle_network_event(None, resources_api.NETWORK, [network], rpc_events.CREATED) self.agent_ext.handle_network_event(None, resources_api.NETWORK, [network], rpc_events.DELETED) self.agent_ext._add_association_for_net.assert_not_called() self.agent_ext._remove_association_for_net.assert_not_called() def test_network_event_association(self): network = network_object.Network(self.context, **base.NETWORK1) net_assoc = self._fake_net_assoc(base.NETWORK1, bgpvpn.BGPVPN_L3, **base.BGPVPN_L3_RT100) net_info = agent_base_info.NetworkInfo(base.NETWORK1['id']) net_info.add_association(net_assoc) self.agent_ext.networks_info = {base.NETWORK1['id']: net_info} self.agent_ext._add_association_for_net = mock.Mock() self.agent_ext._remove_association_for_net = mock.Mock() self.agent_ext.handle_network_event(None, resources_api.NETWORK, [network], rpc_events.UPDATED) self.agent_ext._add_association_for_net.assert_called_once() self.agent_ext.handle_network_event(None, resources_api.NETWORK, [network], rpc_events.CREATED) self.agent_ext._add_association_for_net.assert_called_once() self.agent_ext._remove_association_for_net.assert_not_called() self.agent_ext.handle_network_event(None, resources_api.NETWORK, [network], rpc_events.DELETED) self.agent_ext._remove_association_for_net.assert_called_once() self.agent_ext._add_association_for_net.assert_called_once()

commit_message:
Replace tenant_id with project_id

tenant_id is been discarded for a long time. this patch is mainly
to replace tenant_id with project_id.

commit_message:
encap(nsh) encap(ethternet) does not set outter mac

Closes-Bug: #1857954
https://www.openvswitch.org/support/dist-docs/ovs-actions.7.html
encap(ethernet) leave ethernet source and destination are initially
zeroed. while decap() don't know whether a ethernet header inside or
not, can not set dst mac unless check nsh next protocol filed,
but here leave it be.

Change-Id: I4c2b85d07ee181f92c6e766fea9b5e9a727bd513

commit_message:
port pair leave some parameter no default value set

Closes-Bug: #1855410
Tempest tests: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/714286/

create port pair parameter --service-function-parameters is a dict,
if it short of some keys, function normalize_sf_parameters will not
set default value for those keys. for example, if only set weight key,
port pair will has no correlation which will furter lead to port pair
group create failed.

Change-Id: Id86828d5ea6f43a7ea72074f78e9d85663be67bc

restart neutron-openvswitch-agent dl_vlan is None

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Ic91f7048da4f183d6558c63b277bd015750e3606
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-sfc refs/changes/10/789510/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Send heartbeat_threshold/rate frames before timeout
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-02-28 06:21:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging/commit/b58643f3d6242526af5af04f0a8578eacd76d306', 'message': 'Send heartbeat_threshold/rate frames before timeout

The heartbeat specs in AMQP is saying that we should send at least 2
frames before closing the connection [1].

The current implementation was sending only one frame in the interval.
If for some reason that frame is lost, we have no other chance to send
another frame in the interval and the rabbit broker can decide to close
the connection, ending with "Server unexpectedly closed connection"
error in logs.

This is fixing the implementation by relying on the heartbeat_rate
parameter. With a default rate of 2, it will send at least 2 frames
before the heartbeat_threshold_timeout is reached.

Note also that the current implementation is not fully correct as it
will wait an extra heartbeat_threshold_timeout/heartbeat_rate/2 seconds
before sending the frame.
An easy workaround for this is to set the heartbeat_rate to 3 in the
config.

[1] https://www.amqp.org/specification/0-9-1/amqp-org-download

commit_message:
Send heartbeat_threshold/rate frames before timeout

The heartbeat specs in AMQP is saying that we should send at least 2
frames before closing the connection [1].

The current implementation was sending only one frame in the interval.
If for some reason that frame is lost, we have no other chance to send
another frame in the interval and the rabbit broker can decide to close
the connection, ending with "Server unexpectedly closed connection"
error in logs.

This is fixing the implementation by relying on the heartbeat_rate
parameter. With a default rate of 2, it will send at least 2 frames
before the heartbeat_threshold_timeout is reached.

Note also that the current implementation is not fully correct as it
will wait an extra heartbeat_threshold_timeout/heartbeat_rate/2 seconds
before sending the frame.
An easy workaround for this is to set the heartbeat_rate to 3 in the
config.

[1] https://www.amqp.org/specification/0-9-1/amqp-org-download

Closes-bug: #2008734

Signed-off-by: Arnaud Morin <arnaud.morin@ovhcloud.com>
Change-Id: Icae57315a93a172754bd5fbf3b89f4dec894a7b2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/14/875614/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'we send the heartbeat.'), # NOTE(amorin): heartbeat in kombu/py-amqp is an interval to send # heartbeat frames, so we must send them every threshold/rate heartbeat = int(self.heartbeat_timeout_threshold/self.heartbeat_rate) heartbeat=heartbeat,

Update python testing classifier

Yoga testing runtime[1] has been updated to add py39
testing as voting. Unit tests update are handled by the
job template change in openstack-zuul-job

commit_message:
Updating python testing classifier as per Yoga testing runtime

Yoga testing runtime[1] has been updated to add py39
testing as voting. Unit tests update are handled by the
job template change in openstack-zuul-job

- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs/+/820286

this commit updates the classifier in setup.cfg file.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/yoga.html

Change-Id: Ib30dca67f7d9a086d09ca997ca0f03d5bb2c0208

https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/blob/master/docs/changelog.rst#v3180-2020-07-23

subject: Allow maridbcheck socket to FreeBind
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-02-22 08:07:32.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/galera_server_post_install.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-galera_server/commit/f9a8567e61e09e3c6ffd6b8885cb493c6c7a7a70', 'message': "Allow maridbcheck socket to FreeBind

Once we've removed network.target from wanted targets for
mariadbcheck.socket, it started to fail to startup intermitently in LXC
deployments, since it was trying to bind on IP address that is not
brought up yet. At the same time we can't wait for IP being up, as
OVS while providing network, waits for socket.target as it needs
to have ovsdb started up, so waiting for network.target does
create circular dependency.

To avoid that we're allowing socket to bind on IP even when IP is not
UP yet. Other possible solution would be to bind on 0.0.0.0.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/872896
Change-Id: Ia4cde2153813e68419d261cd94e3017523177142
Closes-Bug: #2003631
Related-Bug: #2002653
(cherry picked from commit 8a8d29ea490fba6695e3356831846466f6991089)
"}]
commit_message:
Allow maridbcheck socket to FreeBind

Once we've removed network.target from wanted targets for
mariadbcheck.socket, it started to fail to startup intermitently in LXC
deployments, since it was trying to bind on IP address that is not
brought up yet. At the same time we can't wait for IP being up, as
OVS while providing network, waits for socket.target as it needs
to have ovsdb started up, so waiting for network.target does
create circular dependency.

To avoid that we're allowing socket to bind on IP even when IP is not
UP yet. Other possible solution would be to bind on 0.0.0.0.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/872896
Change-Id: Ia4cde2153813e68419d261cd94e3017523177142
Closes-Bug: #2003631
Related-Bug: #2002653
(cherry picked from commit 8a8d29ea490fba6695e3356831846466f6991089)

commit_message:
Drop stateless_sg property check from base method

This patch is addition to patch [1], in which tests of stateless
security group feature are checking for stateless_sg property,
and adding ingress rule accordingly.

This patch drops extra internal check inside
create_ingress_metadata_secgroup_rule, so it can be used without
dependency in stateless_sg property.

For example:
When testing security group logging integration with stateless
security groups, there will be no need to add specifically that extra
stateless_sg property.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-tempest-plugin/+/871397

Change-Id: Ic7b021ad262549aee0e4b3ef951791a6d30580b4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-tempest-plugin refs/changes/09/874109/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(slaweq): in case of stateless security groups, there is no # "related" or "established" traffic matching at all so even if # egress traffic to 169.254.169.254 is allowed by default SG, we # need to explicitly allow ingress traffic from the metadata server # to be able to receive responses in the guest vm cls.create_security_group_rule( security_group_id=secgroup_id, direction=neutron_lib_constants.INGRESS_DIRECTION, protocol=neutron_lib_constants.PROTO_NAME_TCP, remote_ip_prefix='169.254.169.254/32', description='metadata out' )
deleted_lines: if getattr(cls, 'stateless_sg'): # NOTE(slaweq): in case of stateless security groups, there is no # "related" or "established" traffic matching at all so even if # egress traffic to 169.254.169.254 is allowed by default SG, we # need to explicitly allow ingress traffic from the metadata server # to be able to receive responses in the guest vm cls.create_security_group_rule( security_group_id=secgroup_id, direction=neutron_lib_constants.INGRESS_DIRECTION, protocol=neutron_lib_constants.PROTO_NAME_TCP, remote_ip_prefix='169.254.169.254/32', description='metadata out' )

commit_message:
Add support for HAProxy L7 checks

This change add several configuration options to enable HTTP checks
to the HAProxy configuration, instead of the default TCP connection
checks (which continue to be the default). It also enables /healthcheck
endpoint for heat-api and heat-cfn-api on openstack releases >= queens.

Closes-Bug: #1880610
Change-Id: I94c9418c82cdddd5a5d9ed400ab47889bfb225b1

commit_message:
Normalise format of OVN agent heartbeat timestamp

A recent change [1] to show the real heartbeat timestamp from OVN agents
had a side effect of changing the timestamp format, which now includes a
timezone:

    +-------------------+----------------------------------+
    | Field             | Value                            |
    +-------------------+----------------------------------+
    | last_heartbeat_at | 2023-02-23 14:12:07.471000+00:00 |
    +-------------------+----------------------------------+

This unexpected format change causes some clients to fail to parse the
response to GET /v2.0/agents.

Normalise the format of the timestamp to remove timezone information.
Also remove the microsecond part, which was not done for OVN, but is
absent from other network agents.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/844179

Closes-Bug: #2008257
Change-Id: I75a37fb9b49a421e4524da6b56ef8362ceb6107b

commit_message:
Fix 6.2 compute RPC version alias

The alias for the 6.2 compute RPC version says
antilope but that is spelled incorrectly and
should be antelope.

Change-Id: I0a1e47baf9f8115cf1d02d57659a88b26eae89d0

commit_message:
Follow up: Hitachi: Change option name `hitachi_pool` to `hitachi_pools`

This patch changes option name ``hitachi_pool`` to ``hitachi_pools`` and
to set ``hitachi_pool`` as deprecated name, along review comment[*1]
On the related patch[*2], we've supported MULTIPLE pools,
but option name is still ``hitachi_pool``.

[1] review comment: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/846977/2/cinder/volume/drivers/hitachi/hbsd_common.py#52
[2] Related-Id: I49ac061011293900b04a7a5b90ff5b840521993d

Change-Id: I6b5f34545f8fd98fd7193e49dc4b9c2f8235e57d

commit_message:
Add strict validation about boolean parameters

This ensures the parameters used by if-else logic accept only boolean
values because non-boolean can result in unexpected behavior.

Change-Id: Ieb4660a4330b8f5f80bcf141ac74a50f4f5aef15

commit_message:
northd: Escape IPv6 address

Current ovn-ctl uses raw address to build --remote option, and fails to
start ovn db if address is a non-escapted IPv6 address.

This ensures IPv6 address is escaped before being passed to the address
options.

Change-Id: Iab3f68cbb3793dc7b51d6a3ab870130032112d87
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ovn refs/changes/70/875370/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: context 'with ipv6' do let :params do { :dbs_listen_ip => '::1' } end it 'creates systemd conf' do is_expected.to contain_augeas('config-ovn-northd').with({ :context => platform_params[:ovn_northd_context], :changes => "set " + platform_params[:ovn_northd_option_name] + " '\"--db-nb-addr=[::1] --db-sb-addr=[::1] --db-nb-create-insecure-remote=yes --db-sb-create-insecure-remote=yes\"'", }) end end

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/2023.1

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/2023.1 branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ifc62b7b4239c70d601de5bc238baaac3d15de17d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tackerclient refs/changes/51/875151/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Update master for stable/2023.1

automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/2023.1.

commit_message:
Disable memory_tracker and file_tracker in unstask.sh properly

stop_dstat() calls stop_process() for dstat, memory_tracker and
file_tracker respectively. Inside stop_process(), a check for the
existence of the service is performed by is_service_enabled().

So even if we apply this seemingly dangerous commit,
is_service_enabled() is respected, so it's safe.

Closes-Bug: #1998990
Change-Id: Ica58cdb1d60c4c796f582d82ed2cde0be94b1a7e
Signed-off-by: Nobuhiro MIKI <nmiki@yahoo-corp.jp>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/37/865237/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if is_service_enabled dstat; then install_dstat fiif is_service_enabled dstat; then start_dstat fi

commit_message:
Don't install weak dependencies in overcloud image build

Without this, python3-networkx pulls in most of the desktop stack,
which is undesirable.

Resolves: rhbz#2152197
Change-Id: I16ff608c8bbe472a6bc63b83e16d8247f7f468ee
(cherry picked from commit 26ed941ae80213364dc5972cdb6b5c1e9b491fb9)

commit_message:
Update docs of User guide and API reference

This patch provides the following User guide and
API documentation updates (fixes) in Tacker Antelope.

User doc:
* Update current support v2 API
  operation status in the cli doc.
* Fix the settings of "vimConnectionInfo".
* Add vimType "ETSINFV.KUBERNETES.V_1"
  to the samples of "vimConnectionInfo".

API doc:
* Fix the misdescription of VNF LCM Interface v2.
* Fix the misdescription of VNF FM Interface v1.
* Fix the misdescription of VNF PM Interface v2.
* Fix the format of request parameters
  in Prometheus Plugin Interface
  and Fault Notification Interface.

Implements: blueprint enhance-change-package
Implements: blueprint support-auto-lcm
Co-Author: Taiki Kimura <taiki.kimura@ntt-at.co.jp>
Change-Id: I50c130d5de812efac631ed8ad1432a98a9d00e6c

commit_message:
Validate integer parameters

The following parameters accept only integers. This adds validation
to enforce the proper type.
 - other_config:vlan-limit
 - other_config:n-revalidator-threads
 - other_config:n-handler-threads

Change-Id: I359d6ef5eb24fe4d7cc1070aabc6ca5256d7f3b5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-vswitch refs/changes/97/875297/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if $vlan_limit != undef { validate_legacy(Integer, 'validate_integer', $vlan_limit) } if $revalidator_cores != undef { validate_legacy(Integer, 'validate_integer', $revalidator_cores) } if $handler_cores != undef { validate_legacy(Integer, 'validate_integer', $handler_cores) }

commit_message:
CI fixes and workarounds

- Update shim-signed name for ubuntu jammy
Latest update for the shim-signed package changed the name of
the shimx64.efi signed file from shimx64.efi.signed to
shimx64.efi.signed.latest
- ansible lint temporary exclude rules
- pin python-openstackclient to version <6.1.0 as higher versions
are incompatible with openstacksdk < 0.103.0 and we pin it to
version 0.99.0 because of bifrost incompatibility with
ansible-collections-openstack version 2 or higher

Change-Id: If4cfd9cc67b372d4fbbdc0a6ef928496cede1892

subject: Magnum: Enable API test
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-02-23 18:39:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/commit/c0162ceafca3105d0899a37f0c8cee404c27b3d2', 'message': "Magnum: Drop unused and outdated workaround

Recent magnum packages require python-werkzeug[1] and we don't have to
install the package additionally.

[1] https://github.com/rdo-packages/magnum-distgit/commit/bafe87ce31a2d9450a3645bb807a80407d433d24

Change-Id: I5eb150def6744fb52043ef8413e72514d13f9c2e
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2023-02-23 18:43:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/commit/65fa9951ef9fa783bdd285380da3313994ad1140', 'message': "Magnum: Enable API test

This enables the basic API test of Magnum so that we can ensure API and
the conductor services are running.

Also, recent magnum packages require python-werkzeug[1] and we don't
have to install the package additionally. This removes the outdated
(and unused) workaround.

[1] https://github.com/rdo-packages/magnum-distgit/commit/bafe87ce31a2d9450a3645bb807a80407d433d24

Change-Id: I5eb150def6744fb52043ef8413e72514d13f9c2e
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2023-02-23 18:43:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/commit/4fc51116e97bb926ebf5afde7c8031508f05a0c1', 'message': "Magnum: Enable API test

This enables the basic API test of Magnum so that we can ensure API and
the conductor services are running.

Also, recent magnum packages require python-werkzeug[1] and we don't
have to install the package additionally. This removes the outdated
(and unused) workaround.

commit_message:
Magnum: Enable API test

This enables the basic API test of Magnum so that we can ensure API and
the conductor services are running.

Also, recent magnum packages require python-werkzeug[1] and we don't
have to install the package additionally. This removes the outdated
(and unused) workaround.

[1] https://github.com/rdo-packages/magnum-distgit/commit/bafe87ce31a2d9450a3645bb807a80407d433d24

Change-Id: I5eb150def6744fb52043ef8413e72514d13f9c2e

commit_message:
Remove reference to 'all-plugin' tox environment

The 'all-plugin' tox environment was deprecated by this patch [1].
Instead of the 'all-plugin' it is recommended to use the 'all' tox
environment.

This patch removes any reference to 'all-plugin' tox environment and
updates the documentation so that the installation steps work with
the 'all' venv.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/543974

Change-Id: I693e4a106f11e0cadac369fbc186e54ffff13d41

deleted_lines: Clone this repository to the destination machine, and call from the repo:: $ pip install -e . $ tox -e all-plugin -- senlin_tempest_plugin $ tox -e all-plugin -- senlin_tempest_plugin.tests.api.policies.test_policy_update.TestPolicyUpdate.test_policy_update

commit_message:
Add test_account_acls option to func tests

If specified, account ACL tests will be explicitly enabled or skipped.
Useful for testing auth systems other than tempauth which claim support
for account ACLs.

Change-Id: I14b9911a49ddd9025a50cb93e5b9160b549d1a32

subject: Use upper-constraints in docs job
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-02-16 08:20:35.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-fwaas/commit/f23379938e89409c419272e32bab43e1924b058d', 'message': "Use upper-constraints in docs job

Since we use usedevelop=True, as a result neutron-fwaas
installation happens at 'develop-inst' phase and it installs
requirements from requirements.txt without considering
tox constraints, This can lead to issue where broken
requirements are installed in docs job and as a result
it will fail.

In order to get constraints be considered for this case, add
requirements.txt to deps for docs env(same as [1]).

[1 https://review.opendev.org/q/Ic8f6472fe708d12f8fc129729465367083e1095a

Change-Id: Iea9556f6f025ad2f3dfa38fd401aa64414bd561f
"}]
commit_message:
Use upper-constraints in docs job

Since we use usedevelop=True, as a result neutron-fwaas
installation happens at 'develop-inst' phase and it installs
requirements from requirements.txt without considering
tox constraints, This can lead to issue where broken
requirements are installed in docs job and as a result
it will fail.

In order to get constraints be considered for this case, add
requirements.txt to deps for docs env(same as [1]).

[1 https://review.opendev.org/q/Ic8f6472fe708d12f8fc129729465367083e1095a

Change-Id: Iea9556f6f025ad2f3dfa38fd401aa64414bd561f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-fwaas refs/changes/62/874062/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Do not remove requirements.txt from deps list as without it # upper constraints will not be used for deps listed in requirements.txt # and may cause issues deps = -c{env:TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE:https://releases.openstack.org/constraints/upper/master} -r{toxinidir}/doc/requirements.txt -r{toxinidir}/requirements.txt

commit_message:
Allow for jinja2 templating of puppet_config

In support of the wider Multi-RHEL effort. We will
need to support templating to allow for Ansible to
determine which container needs to be pulled to
the hosts based on their OS version.

This change adds support for that templating of
the puppet_config files.

Change-Id: I5b6a34c4013ad86585bdbd29dab882dd0dd1b3e2
(cherry picked from commit 524242606f5ce17c1002aa8f45c4a4dce7bc9c20)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-10-13 01:42:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/6facad2b3806d5c9f5f712466a8bf069ad186294', 'message': 'Add configurable delays to the fake drivers

Simulating workloads with the fake driver currently misses the reality
that some operations take time to complete, rather than occuring
instantly. This makes it difficult to mock real workloads for
performance and functional testing of ironic itself.

This change adds configurable random wait times for fake drivers in a
new ironic.conf [fake] section. Each supported driver having one
configuration option controlling the delay. These delays are applied
to operations which typically block in other drivers.

The default value of zero continues the existing behaviour of no
delay. A single integer value will result in a constant delay in
seconds. Two values separated by a comma will result in a triangular
distribution weighted by the first value, specifically in python[1]:

    random.triangular(a, b, a)

Change-Id: I7cb1b50d035939e6c4538b3373002a309bfedea4
[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/random.html#random.triangular
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2022-10-13 02:01:34.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/unit/drivers/test_fake_hardware.py', 'ironic/conf/__init__.py', 'ironic/drivers/modules/fake.py', 'releasenotes/notes/fakedelay-7eac23ad8881a736.yaml', 'ironic/conf/fake.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/393b20204b3adab12e69e6e1d24a221e2751e6ec', 'message': 'Add configurable delays to the fake drivers

commit_message:
Add configurable delays to the fake drivers

Simulating workloads with the fake driver currently misses the reality
that some operations take time to complete, rather than occuring
instantly. This makes it difficult to mock real workloads for
performance and functional testing of ironic itself.

This change adds configurable random wait times for fake drivers in a
new ironic.conf [fake] section. Each supported driver having one
configuration option controlling the delay. These delays are applied
to operations which typically block in other drivers.

The default value of zero continues the existing behaviour of no
delay. A single integer value will result in a constant delay in
seconds. Two values separated by a comma will result in a triangular
distribution weighted by the first value, specifically in python[1]:

    random.triangular(a, b, a)

Change-Id: I7cb1b50d035939e6c4538b3373002a309bfedea4
[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/random.html#random.triangular
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/27/861127/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | There are now configurable random wait times for fake drivers in a new ironic.conf [fake] section. Each supported driver having one configuration option controlling the delay. These delays are applied to operations which typically block in other drivers. This allows more realistic scenarios to be arranged for performance and functional testing of ironic itself.

commit_message:
Remove unused logic with outdated comments

We currently disable catch_selinux_alerts because of frequent timeout
caused by selinux alerts, but having these old logics/comments can be
confusing for future maintenance.

Change-Id: Idd433c333a38a968622a97e0628e9eb8feb6fa24
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration refs/changes/03/875303/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # FIXME(ykarel) catch_selinux_alerts not work with non ssl scenarios(no rabbitmq alert), # currently running all scenarios without ssl in Fedora and CentOS8, # because glance,nova,mistral py3 has issues when running with eventlet + ssl: # glance https://bugs.launchpad.net/glance/+bug/1769006 # nova https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1808975 # mistral https://bugs.launchpad.net/mistral/+bug/1808953 elif [ -f /etc/fedora-release ] || [[ "${ID,,}" = "centos" ]]; then echo "non ssl scenario, ignoring it now."

commit_message:
Unable to add access rule type user with space or @ character

The usernames in CIFS helper were not properly escaped.
Proposed patch encloses usernames in quotes.
If username starts with @ (ie. groupname) the quotes are applied
without @ (eg.: @group name -> @"group name"

Change-Id: I12240d6346062a9a26142d2b4e423a71d0ae62b3
Closes-Bug: #1706539

added_lines: To run a selected subset of unit tests with ``pytest``: * (Optional but recommended) Create and activate a virtual environment:: pip install --user virtualenv virtualenv .env . .env/bin/activate * Install prerequisites:: pip install -r requirements.txt -r test-requirements.txt -c py36-constraints.txt * Install ``swift`` package in your Python environment in an editable mode:: pip install -e . * Run some unit tests, for example:: pytest test/unit/common/middleware/crypto * Run all unit tests:: pytest test/unit * By default ``tox`` will run **all of the unit test** and pep8 checks listed in tox -e py3 or::

commit_message:
Bump external modules used in unit tests

It seems Puppetfile_unit has not been updated properly. This bumps
the versions used in the file so that we test our modules with
the latest dependent modules.

Change-Id: I61a5060a1f8a82182a2b90d95ebb3af93dc101b0

commit_message:
Zaqar: Fix missing bind options for websocket

Currently zaqar websocket service always uses 127.0.0.1. This fixes
that and ensures the expected IP version is used.

Change-Id: I4d1a90581886f1b07f48bf1139813f3be9d41757

commit_message:
Gnocchi: Use appropriate IP version for statsd

The gnocchi-statsd service users 0.0.0.0 (IPv4) by default.

This ensures the host option is configured so that the expected IP
version is used.

Change-Id: I9acf01cfe376acc0e74655f54bb95227fc05b6ba

commit_message:
ovn: Capture additional items

This adds the following two items to logs captured during CI.

- the sysconfig/default file which contains ovn-northd command line
  options

- the created remote connections of ovn nb/sb db

Change-Id: Ia8024a2916c16d7067513cfa33565e3d6961b9cc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration refs/changes/34/875034/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: mkdir -p $LOG_DIR/etc/default mkdir -p $LOG_DIR/etc/sysconfig sudo ovn-nbctl get-connection > $LOG_DIR/ovn-nbctl_get-connection.txt sudo ovn-sbctl get-connection > $LOG_DIR/ovn-sbctl_get-connection.txt fi if uses_debs ; then if [ -f /etc/default/ovn-northd ]; then mkdir -p $LOG_DIR/etc/default sudo cp /etc/default/ovn-northd $LOG_DIR/etc/default/ fi elif is_fedora; then if [ -f /etc/sysconfig/ovn-northd ]; then mkdir -p $LOG_DIR/etc/sysconfig sudo cp /etc/sysconfig/ovn-northd $LOG_DIR/etc/sysconfig/ fi

commit_message:
Add helpers to generate certificates

... so that users can more easily generate and manage certificates
used by ovs and ovn.

Change-Id: Ie7f0c3b6d7e5b760e14adef973497810b06669cd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-vswitch refs/changes/11/875311/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'spec_helper' describe 'vswitch::pki::cert' do let(:title) {'foo'} shared_examples_for 'vswitch::pki::cert' do it 'shoud generate a certificate' do is_expected.to contain_exec('ovs-req-and-sign-cert-foo').with( :command => 'ovs-pki req+sign foo', :cwd => '/etc/openvswitch', :creates => '/etc/openvswitch/foo-cert.pem', :path => ['/usr/sbin', '/sbin', '/usr/bin', '/bin'], ) end end on_supported_os({ :supported_os => OSDefaults.get_supported_os }).each do |os,facts| context "on #{os}" do let (:facts) do facts.merge!(OSDefaults.get_facts()) end it_behaves_like "vswitch::pki::cert" end end end

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-02-27 06:46:13.000000000', 'files': ['projects/70_cinder/resources.sh', 'projects/60_nova/resources.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/grenade/commit/4102f1b503c3b537fe08b24da235f10d3b2e29bd', 'message': 'Bump ping timeout to 60 seconds

and lead to ping timeout.

With [1] included noticed it taking more than 40 seconds
to boot testvm, so bumping timeout to 60 seconds will
help in such cases.

commit_message:
Bump ping timeout to 60 seconds

The jobs fails intermittently on ping check
with current timeout of 30 seconds.

The testvm can take time to boot and have network
ready on slow systems and using qemu hypervisor
and lead to ping timeout.

With [1] included noticed it taking more than 40 seconds
to boot testvm, so bumping timeout to 60 seconds will
help in such cases.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/grenade/+/874417

Related-Bug: #1463631
Related-Bug: #2007357
Change-Id: Ibdd030e126d508e6ff24cde180c611ada7f24cb3
(cherry picked from commit 3f9fe2e8fc1fccf0324538274e3b07b3e90b96b9)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/grenade refs/changes/40/875340/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add openstack-python3-charm-zed-jobs to .zuul.yaml

The project template job openstack-python3-charm-zed-jobs introduces
py310 as a voting job, since hacluster runs on jammy, this is a needed
to gate on it.

Change-Id: I437b79e951aec6231d075cf1560f36f0c45884fc

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/2023.1

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/2023.1 branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ic8de91fb370bfd52b3fb9738ffddd5c52f91566d

commit_message:
MySQL: Use appropriate IP version

Currently we always use IPv4 for MySQL even in the test cases which are
supposed to use IPv6. This fixes that and ensures the expected ip
version is used.

Change-Id: I483f04376f29b75dcca20061ae381c7e71f26caf

commit_message:
CentOS: Install barbican-retry service

RDO now provides the package to launch the barbican-retry service[1].
This change ensures the package and the service are configured by
the corresponding class.

[1] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/openstack/barbican-distgit/+/40434

Change-Id: I134feadb75b397bc159a8fe9e3dbc87915339785

commit_message:
NetApp: move split job to end

Volumes may be busy during split operation, so other actions would fail,
e.g. applying snapdir visibility, setting volume size ..

Closes-Bug: #2007970
Change-Id: I3e36f77f4e46c90af8445601e10eadf9c55ed5f6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/68/873868/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # split at the end: not be blocked by a busy volume if split is not None: vserver_client.split_volume_clone(share_name)
deleted_lines: if split is not None: provisioning_options['split'] = split

commit_message:
Use SSL database connections with nova-manage

When Galera SSL is enabled, use SSL encrypted database connections with
nova-manage commands where a connection string is provided.

Change-Id: I7019b966b475c09a4e3218461941c1112ae28028
(cherry picked from commit 740a26e7eacbb5975d041b1f9aa7424a1cc9526c)

commit_message:
trove_datastore_version: Handle missing datastore

The trove_datastore_version resource fails if the datastore is not yet
created. This fixes that problem.

Change-Id: I403f0ede9061eb0a9361b084ada26954250fb2e6
(cherry picked from commit 4e25bbbe9f31cf966567f892dbfa1a5aea0d92ef)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-trove refs/changes/13/875013/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: begin request('datastore version', 'list', datastore).each do |attrs| dvs[attrs[:name]] = attrs end rescue Puppet::ExecutionFailure => e if ! e.message.match("Datastore '#{datastore}' cannot be found") raise e end
deleted_lines: request('datastore version', 'list', datastore).each do |attrs| dvs[attrs[:name]] = attrs

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-02-26 07:08:02.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/northd.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ovn/commit/db30911f99f934372c7db1619b8652f7cac397b3', 'message': 'Fix missing dependencies about command line options setting

The command line options should be updated after ovn package is
installed, otherwise the file provided by the package is not used.

Also, ovn-northd service should be restarted when its command line
options are modified, otherwise the modification is not loaded by
the service.

Change-Id: I113040ee3f05f2a914613de8847e752ff31965d8
'}]
commit_message:
Fix missing dependencies about command line options setting

The command line options should be updated after ovn package is
installed, otherwise the file provided by the package is not used.

Also, ovn-northd service should be restarted when its command line
options are modified, otherwise the modification is not loaded by
the service.

Change-Id: I113040ee3f05f2a914613de8847e752ff31965d8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ovn refs/changes/10/875310/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Drop empty elements from constraint/requirement files

We should filter out empty elements from lists that are provided as
input to the role, to ensure idempotence of build constraints and
requirements file as a result.

Additionally to that we should ensure to control jinja whitespaces
not to add extra new lines to the end of files.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/872896
Change-Id: Ide47712f775c91d90b749bc8e4d8f87c5bd658f2
Closes-Bug: #2004546
(cherry picked from commit 2a25337b9844b4b8a90420e864ee38e8168ce586)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ansible-role-python_venv_build refs/changes/34/874734/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: content: |- {% for item in _venv_install_pip_packages | select() %} content: |- {% for item in venv_build_global_constraints | select() %} content: |- {%- if (venv_wheel_build_enable | bool) and {%- else %} {% for item in venv_build_constraints | select() %} {%- endif %}
deleted_lines: content: | {% for item in _venv_install_pip_packages %} content: | {% for item in venv_build_global_constraints %} content: | {% if (venv_wheel_build_enable | bool) and {% else %} {% for item in venv_build_constraints %} {% endif %}

subject: Enable qos extension_driver in ovn_db_sync
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-02-17 17:15:58.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/cmd/ovn/neutron_ovn_db_sync_util.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/7b0b76cb9edf7b8ce86da143d5ed00d053a9b8af', 'message': "Enable qos extension_driver in ovn_db_sync

In Change Ib597b62017b56b41009dd4d7359e169f424272b0, the 'qos'
service_plugin is enabled when doing an ovn_db_sync. However, if the
'qos' extension_driver is not installed, it will error out.

Append 'qos' extension_driver when using sync to fix this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1988577
Change-Id: I422d86b8e5650ced4e2cc722cea9cc30061905b4
"}]
commit_message:
Enable qos extension_driver in ovn_db_sync

In Change Ib597b62017b56b41009dd4d7359e169f424272b0, the 'qos'
service_plugin is enabled when doing an ovn_db_sync. However, if the
'qos' extension_driver is not installed, it will error out.

Append 'qos' extension_driver when using sync to fix this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1988577
Change-Id: I422d86b8e5650ced4e2cc722cea9cc30061905b4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/44/874144/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Get conductor metric data

This change adds the capability for the ironic-conductor
and standalone service process to transmit timer and counter
metrics to the message bus notifier which may be consumed by
a ceilometer, ironic-prometheus-exporter, or other consumer of
metrics event data on to the message bus.

This functionality is not presently supported on dedicated API
services such as those running as an ``ironic-api`` application
process, or Ironic WSGI application. This is due to the lack of
an internal trigger mechanism to transmit the data in a metrics
update to the message bus and/or notifier plugin.

This change requires ironic-lib 5.4.0 to collect and ship metrics via
the message bus.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ironic-lib/+/865311
Change-Id: If6941f970241a22d96e06d88365f76edc4683364

added_lines: @METRICS.counter('ConductorManager.create_node') @METRICS.counter('ConductorManager.update_node') @METRICS.counter('ConductorManager.do_node_clean') @METRICS.counter('ConductorManager.do_provisioning_action') @METRICS.counter('ConductorManager._sync_power_states') # Send post-run metrics. METRICS.send_gauge( 'ConductorManager.FailingPowerSyncCount', len(self.power_state_sync_count)) def _sensors_conductor(self, context): """Called to collect and send metrics "sensors" for the conductor.""" while not self._shutdown: # populate the message which will be sent to ceilometer # or other data consumer message = {'message_id': uuidutils.generate_uuid(), 'timestamp': datetime.datetime.utcnow(), 'hostname': CONF.host} try: ev_type = 'ironic.metrics' message['event_type'] = ev_type + '.update' sensor_data = METRICS.get_metric_data() except AttributeError: LOG.warning( 'get_sensors_data has been configured to collect ' 'conductor metris, however the installed ironic-lib ' 'library lacks the functionality. Please consider ' 'upgrading ironic-lib.') except Exception as e: LOG.warning( "An unknown error occured while attempting to collect " "sensor data from within the conductor. Error: %(error)s", {'error': e}) else: message['payload'] = ( self._filter_out_unsupported_types(sensors_data)) if message['payload']: self.sensors_notifier.info( context, ev_type, message) if CONF.conductor.send_sensor_data_for_conductor: if CONF.conductor.send_sensor_data_workers == 1: # Directly call the sensors_conductor when only one # worker is permitted, so we collect data serially # instead. self._sensors_conductor(context) else: # Also, do not apply the general threshold limit to # the self collection of "sensor" data from the conductor, # as were not launching external processes, we're just reading # from an internal data structure, if we can. self._spawn_worker(self._sensors_conductor, context)

commit_message:
Use SSL database connections with nova-manage

When Galera SSL is enabled, use SSL encrypted database connections with
nova-manage commands where a connection string is provided.

Change-Id: I7019b966b475c09a4e3218461941c1112ae28028
(cherry picked from commit 740a26e7eacbb5975d041b1f9aa7424a1cc9526c)

commit_message:
Enable qos extension_driver in ovn_db_sync

In Change Ib597b62017b56b41009dd4d7359e169f424272b0, the 'qos'
service_plugin is enabled when doing an ovn_db_sync. However, if the
'qos' extension_driver is not installed, it will error out.

Append 'qos' extension_driver when using sync to fix this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1988577
Change-Id: I422d86b8e5650ced4e2cc722cea9cc30061905b4

commit_message:
Reduce number of routers created in ``test_gateway_chassis_rebalance``

This patch reduces the number of routers created in
``test_gateway_chassis_rebalance``. For the test purposes, 5 routers
is enough, reduce the test executing time and the OVN load.

This patch also captures the "Port_Binding" update event in the
``WaitForCrLrpPortBindingEvent`` class.

Related-Bug: #2007353
Change-Id: I66b39b1d0dccfbb18bec5646d8954eee8c687f0c

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/2023.1

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/2023.1 branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ibccb66810da8273b2148201d033fc09cb99aa42c

commit_message:
Ensure HM also apply to FIPs associated to LB VIPs

Currently, if a FIP gets associated to a LB with HealthMonitors
it is not included as a new OVN Load Balancer Health Checks. This
means that if the VIP is used, traffic will not be redirected to
the dead members, buit if the FIP is used there is no health checks
being applied and traffic will reach dead members.

This patch adds the extra functionality so that an extra OVN
Load Balancer Health Check is created for the FIPs associated to
the Load Balancer.

Closes-Bug: #1997418

Change-Id: Idbf1fb15076518092ce5fdaa57500d29342f51be

commit_message:
Transport context to all threads

The nova.utils.spawn and spawn_n methods transport
the context (and profiling information) to the
newly created threads. But the same isn't done
when submitting work to thread-pools in the
ComputeManager.

The code doing that for spawn and spawn_n
is extracted to a new function
and called to submit the work to the thread-pools.

Closes-Bug: #1962574
Change-Id: I9085deaa8cf0b167d87db68e4afc4a463c00569c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/67/827467/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/2023.1

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/2023.1 branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ida339593c6fe5a6804dc21ef8b690a78f13874f9

commit_message:
Moving privsep profiles to nova/__init__.py

With the idea being that the nova.privsep package will eventually be removed,
this change makes the first step towards it by extracting the privsep
profiles from it and uploading them at the upmost nova package.

Implements: bp/privsep-usage-review
Change-Id: Ie8fbee4b8f65814fe2b470d1b9eb51c68110cadb

subject: Add Placement error-handling to user guide
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-02-16 02:50:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tacker/commit/e10bf07b8e4221174e120281c307e1482c256206', 'message': "Add Placement error-handling to user guide

This patch adds error-handling to the user guide document for cases
where the v2 APIs 'instantiate', 'scale' and 'heal' fail due to lack of
availability zone resources.
If StandardUserData is used as UserData class, it is possible to
reselect the availability zone as error-handling.
